Pre-Game Insights: The Milwaukee Brewers have a strong home record (40-25) and excel in games where they hit multiple home runs (30-8).
The St. Louis Cardinals have a powerful offense ranking fifth in the NL with 668 runs scored this season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game features starting pitchers Andre Pallante (6-6, 3.80 ERA) for the Cardinals and Freddy Peralta (9-7, 3.70 ERA) for the Brewers.
The Brewers' bullpen has been a strength with a solid ERA, while the Cardinals' bullpen has struggled recently.
